metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16860 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in samba's Heimdal KDC implementation, versions 4.8.x upto, excluding 4.8.12, 4.9.x up to, excluding 4.9.8 and 4.10.x up to,excluding 4.10.3, when used in AD DC mode. A man in the middle attackercould use this flaw to intercept the request to the KDC and replace theuser name (principal) in the request with any desired user name (principal)that exists in the KDC effectively obtaining a ticket for that principal.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16860` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
python3-samba - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
registry-tools - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
samba - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
samba-common - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1

samba-testsuite - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
smbclient - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
winbind - 2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

heimdal-clients - 7.5.0+dfsg-3build1

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.10.0+dfsg-0ubuntu2.1').
heimdal package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.5.0+dfsg-3build1').
